metadata.Name: Polyglot-NER
metadata.Description: A multilingual Named Entity Recognition (NER) system that uses Wikipedia and Freebase to build NER annotators for 40 major languages.
metadata.Paper Title: Polyglot-NER: Massive Multilingual Named Entity Recognition
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, Stony Brook University
metadata.Abstract: The increasing diversity of languages used on the web introduces a new level of complexity to Information Retrieval (IR) systems. We can no longer assume that textual content is written in one language or even the same language family. In this paper, we demonstrate how to build massive multilingual annotators with minimal human expertise and intervention. We describe a system that builds Named Entity Recognition (NER) annotators for 40 major languages using Wikipedia and Freebase. Our approach does not require NER human annotated datasets or language specific resources like treebanks, parallel corpora, and orthographic rules. The novelty of our approach lies in using only language agnostic techniques, while achieving competitive performance.
